p.s: The speaker's idea of love is that love never vannishesvanishes and never changes.
Love will remain eternal and there is nothing that can change that.
The first verse refers to the promise, that people give each other to marry (cf. v. 1).
The mentioned promise is about solving problems instead of throwing the bond of love away.
This start illustrates the point of the value of love and that is important to keep the bond.

In addition to that verse 3 and 4 form an enumeration of things love does not represent, which helps to understand the idea of the speaker.

This illustrates that it does not matter if there are any obstacles, love will always remain.

The last quartrain, which deals with the relationship of love and time begins with a personification in verse 10.
This personificationspersonification strenthensstrengthens the indepenceindependence of love.
While everyting is mortal and can notcannot escape the force of time, love stays eternal.
The influence of time on the appearance is illustrated in the second part of verse 9.
This shows the contrast of how time infects love and other things.
Verse 10 includes the metaphermetaphor sickle's compass which stands for death that is coming sooner with the time.

However Verse 11 shows, that the sickle's compass has no impact on love and that it is going to stay the same regardless of the changes that time produces in for example the appearance of their partner.
In addition to that Verse 9 and 10 do start with the word love.
The anaphora emphasized the power of love, because both verses mention the superiority of love over time.
The last verse of the third strophe includes the metaphermetaphor the edge of doom.
Thus the infinite character of love gets stressed.
Love exists out of time and not even death can destroy this feeling.
The ending couplet creates a contradictory hyperbel.

The speaker is so convinced of his statements, that he implies to never getting proved wrong, because the conditions for him being a liar are, that he never wrote, which he obviously did and that no man ever loved which also obviously happened.
In conclusion Sonnet 116 deals with the definition of love.
The lyrical voice defines love through many negations.
Therefore he describes love, by telling what love not is.
Love is a complex feeling and hard to describe, but the speaker's idea of love is that love always overcomes problems and never changes.
Moreover love is the guide of our lifeslives and gives us security and safety.
And last but not least love is eternal and is the only thing that does not depend on time.
